metadata.title: CASE 575/03: INVESTIGATION INTO SATELLITE LINK MISCONDUCT

overview: This report outlines the misconduct of a UNON/ITS staff member accused of soliciting money to facilitate a satellite connection installation. The investigation highlights breaches in procedures and regulations, recommending corrective actions.

applicable_laws.excerpt: Staff members shall uphold the highest standards of efficiency, competence and integrity. The concept of integrity includes, but is not limited to, probity, impartiality, fairness, honesty and truthfulness in all matters affecting their work and status.

All United Nations staff are obligated to comply with the Financial Regulations and Rules and with administrative instructions issued in connection with those Regulations and Rules. Any staff member who contravenes the Financial Regulations and Rules or corresponding administrative instructions may be held personally accountable and financially liable for his or her actions.
The Financial Regulations and Rules of the United Nations include principles such as fairness, integrity, and transparency in procurement functions.

methodology.description: ID/OIOS reviewed documents relevant to the investigation and researched pertinent UN rules and regulations. Interviews were conducted across various UN offices.

background.context: The investigation commenced following a 2003 incident where a UNON/ITS staff member wrongfully solicited funds under the pretense of installing a satellite link.
timeline: 2003-05: Alleged solicitation of Ksh 22,250 by UNON/ITS staff.

allegations.description: UNON/ITS staff member engaged in arranging an extension of the satellite link from UNPOS to RSG residence for monetary gain.
allegations.findings: The individual accepted payments under false pretenses without authorization and failed to deliver the promised services, violating Staff Regulation 1.2 and UN financial rules.

findings: The UNON/ITS Staff Member violated staff regulations and financial rules, improperly accepting payment for services not rendered.

violations.excerpt: By personally undertaking to extend the satellite link to the RSG residence and failing to provide the service after receiving payment, the staff member breached integrity standards.
The staff member acted against the Financial Regulations by undertaking unauthorized financial transactions.

actions: UNON should take appropriate administrative action against the implicated staff member.
UNON takes corrective measures to ensure that the staff member refunds the money collected from UNPOS.
UNON and UNPOS administrations instruct staff on adhering to procurement procedures.
UNON issues advisories emphasizing the necessity for written service requests.
UNON shares report findings with the Representative of the Secretary General, UNPOS.
